Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. But it was still entertaining.

What is left of Planet Earth is populated by a few poor and starving rag-tag survivors. They must eat bugs and insects, or whatever they can find. The wealthy live in the mountains, under ominous guard, for with enough money one doesn’t need to weigh under 50 pounds. A couple go cavorting through heavily blistered landscapes to the rhythmic inflections of “Didgeridoo”. This quick romp will make you roll on the floor

Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is going to be criticized by some because it has very little coherence or actual martial arts, and ultimately that's true but there's one thing you have to remember with this movie it is acted like a biggest spoof of itself. It doesn't actually take itself all that serious at all,
